page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF UPPER WHARFEDALE
page.content: {Upper Wharfedale}is an area of outstanding natural beauty with the main natural feature being the{River {Wharfe}from where the{'Dale '}takes its name.The surrounding hillsides are mainly limestone and so{quarrying}is extensive. Other than this quarrying, the area is essentially rural in character and the landscape is dotted with farms with {sheep and dairy farming}being prevolent. The farming community forms the true native population, although the majority of people in the area now travel to their work in the larger towns lying to the south of the area. {(Skipton,Keighley,Bradford and Leeds) There are many tourists in the summer and so this also provides employment for local people.The{Dales National {Park}oversees countryside care.
